snippet: The federal government had challenged a law in the Australian Capital Territory that allowed same-sex marriages in the nation’s capital, Canberra, and its surrounding area.
abstract: Australia's highest court strikes down a landmark law that had begun allowing the country's first same-sex marriages.
lead_paragraph: The federal government had challenged a law in the Australian Capital Territory that allowed same-sex marriages in the nation’s capital, Canberra, and its surrounding area.

headline.main: Australians Strike Down Law Letting Gays Marry
headline.print_headline: Australians Strike Down Law Letting Gays Marry

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
